aptisRootModule.name: aptisRootModule
aptisRootModule.contactinfo: Technical Support/Customer Service Nortel Networks Postal: 11 Elizabeth Drive Chelmsford, MA 01824 Tel: In the USA: Dial 1-800-758-4827 to contact a Technical Support engineer. Outside the USA: Contact your Regional Nortel Networks Support Prime. For information about the Nortel Networks Network Access Division, go to the World Wide Web (WWW) site at http://www.nortelnetworks.com.

Boolean.name: Boolean
Boolean.description: A version of TruthValue that makes sense, corresponding to the natural values of true(1) and false(0).

aptis.name: aptis
aptis.description: The root of the sub-tree assigned to Aptis by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA).

aptis_reg.name: aptis_reg
aptis_reg.description: Sub-tree for registrations, including product and individual system boards.

aptis_generic.name: aptis_generic
aptis_generic.description: Sub-tree for common object and event definitions.

aptis_products.name: aptis_products
aptis_products.description: Sub-tree for product-specific object and event definitions.

aptis_config.name: aptis_config
aptis_config.description: The collection of tables that make up the persistent configuration of the system.

aptis_monitoring.name: aptis_monitoring
aptis_monitoring.description: The collection of tables that allows monitoring of the dynamic state of the system.

aptis_actions.name: aptis_actions
aptis_actions.description: This subtree contains variables which allow a management station to invoke certain administrative actions such as file transfers, etc. These variables correspond to action commands in the CLI.

aptis_exp.name: aptis_exp
aptis_exp.description: This subtree contains variables which are currently being tested and are not yet fully supported.

aptis_traps.name: aptis_traps
aptis_traps.description: This subtree contains the aptis specific traps.

config_sync.name: config_sync
config_sync.description: These variables are returned in SNMP Set Reply packets that modify configuration, allowing the NMS to keep its configuration database synchronized with the switch. They describe the state of the config database before and after a transaction that corresponds to an SNMP SET REQUEST. These values only have meaning when appended to a SET-REPLY PDU.

prevGenNum.name: prevGenNum
prevGenNum.description: The value of the database subtree's GenNum before the transaction was applied.

deltaCount.name: deltaCount
deltaCount.description: The expected delta to the database subtree's GenNum value as a result of the transaction in question.

currentGenNum.name: currentGenNum
currentGenNum.description: The resulting value of the database subtree's GenNum after the transaction has been applied.
